articles.description: The peak of a meteor showers could see up to 50 an hour zoom across our skies, while the year's third consecutive supermoon will also appear.
articles.content:
Stargazers are in for a double treat this week with the peak of the Eta Aquariids meteor showers and the appearance of the third consecutive supermoon in the skies above Kent. 
The Eta Aquariids are the first of two showers each year caused by Halleys Comet.… [+1730 chars]

articles.description: SPACEX'S Starlink satellites have been reported up and down the country - but can you see Starlink tonight?
articles.content:
Starlink visibility from London
Timings with good visibility:
9.26pm - Starlink-3 - For five minutes.
Look from the southwest to the east.
10.01pm, May 5 - Starlink-3 - For six minutes.
Look from the southwest to the east.
